intro: Centaurea sakariyaensis, commonly known as Sakarya thistle, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Centaurea sakariyaensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
